meanings.definition: Show or prove to be right or reasonable.
meanings.sent1: The evidence clearly justifies his claim in court.
meanings.sent2: Using facts and logic can justify your argument.
meanings.sent3: His excuse for being late barely justifies his tardiness.
meanings.sent4: Her hard work justifies her promotion to manager.
meanings.sent5: The success of the project justifies the long hours we put in.

meanings.sent1: The delicious smell of baking bread justifies waking up early.
meanings.sent2: A healthy lifestyle justifies regular exercise.
meanings.sent3: The tempting sale justifies buying a new pair of shoes.
meanings.sent4: The breathtaking view justifies the long hike to the top.
meanings.sent5: The exciting opportunity justifies taking a risk.

meanings.definition: Declare or make righteous in the sight of God.
meanings.sent1: The priest justifies the sinner through confession.
meanings.sent2: The religious ceremony justifies the believer in the eyes of God.
meanings.sent3: The repentant man's actions justify his redemption.
meanings.sent4: The prayer justifies the faithful in their faith.
meanings.sent5: The act of charity justifies the believer's devotion.
